iati-activity.description: The overall aim of the project is to empower approximately 25,000 beneficiaries most vulnerable to HIV/AIDS in the Chiradzulu District, which has the highest rate of HIV/AIDS in Malawi. They will target women and girls, and work to develop sustainable livelihoods through improved production and market access. The project includes a broad range of activities which focus on support for sustainable economic development, as well as gender equality and empowerment for women. Activities will include: the establishment of village savings and credit associations; business management training for 5,000 women; the formation of enterprise groups to support beneficiaries to manage profitable small-scale businesses; support 200 women to establish ten producer organisations, in addition to the establishment of at least four private sector partnerships, to enable women to participate in supply chains.
